actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 17 May, in Matadi, a policeman has been executed pointblank by 5 unknown attackers. This is 13th attack of this kind in the city taking lives of 6 people in total.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 17 May, in Ndama, a dead ADF soldier has been found. The person believed to be one of the attackers of Ndama village on 15th of May and believed to be fatally injured by FARDC. The ongoing clashes with ADF caused massive population movements.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 17 May, in Kilhewa, ADF has attacked several villages and soldiers of FARDC. In ensued gunfight 1 FARDC serviceman has been killed and  9 civilians executed. Several people have been kidnapped. 7 rockets together with other ammunition has been seized. The attack has been claimed by ISIS (location was referred as Talyata).

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: La Prunelle; Twitter; La Libre Afrique
notes: On 17 May, in Kiwanja, a protest of local residents against impunity of kidnappers and police brutality. The protest has been sparkled by discovery of a dead villager as well by killing of a child on 16 May by police during the earlier protest [size=no report].

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 16 May, in Kananga, 3 men armed with AK-47 broke into a house stole valuables and took 2 minor girls of 13 and 16 years old. 16 Years old has been raped before being released. The attackers are suspected to be linked to recent jailbreak from Kananga Central prison.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: Radio Okapi; Fizi Media TV; AFP
notes: On 16 May, in Minembwe, the community mayor reported that there are around 20000-25000 IDPs that arrived to the city to look for safety due to ongoing fighting in the area. ICRC called for emergency mobilization of all available resources to overcome the situation.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 15 May, in Tara, unidentified armed group attacked and pillaged fish market killing 4 civilians killed and 2 gravely wounded.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 15 May, in Ndama, ADF attacked village killing 2: pregnant woman and her husband, injuring 2 and abducting 3 others. Property has been looted. The assailant has been identified and reported as ADF by head of Watalinga area.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 10 May 2019 (on or before). LUCHA activist demonstrated in front of the Airtel office in Goma. Police forces intervened, assaulting some of the demonstrators. Police also used tear gas. Eleven protesters were injured during the intervention. [size=dozens]

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 May 2019. LUCHA members demonstrated in front of the Airtel office in Bukavu, over the telecommunication provider's poor service. [size=no report]

actor1: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Banyindu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mtetezi Militia
notes: 10 May 2019. Communal clashes continued between the Ngumino and the Banyindu and Bafuliru, in alliance with or under the leadership of Mtetezi, in the Tanganyika region of Fizi and Minembwe region. During the clashes, the villages of Kigazura, Marunde, Kivogera, and Turambo were burned (no coordinates available). Many locals have been displaced by the communal violence following the murder of a Banyindu chief on 04/05.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 09 May 2019. Residents of the Ndosho neighborhood demonstrated in Goma, following the seizure of their homes by police. Police tear gassed the demonstrators,  which included a notable number of women and children. [size= 80 households]

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 09 May 2019. The NDC-Renove attacked APCLS in the Shoa, Osso-Banyungu (no coordinates available). The APCLS repelled the NDC-Renove.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 09 May 2019. After the NDC-Renove attacked their forces in Shoa,  the APCLS attacked the NDC-Renove in Loashi. The village was looted by the fighters and civilians fled the area. Local sources accused the FARDC of supporting the NDC-Renove during the clash, which the military and other community leaders denied. The NDC-Renove remained in Loashi, while the APCLS combatants maintained control of Shoa and Buabo.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 09 May 2019. During the night, ADF forces looted  Mangboko, Oicha according to local sources. The assailants also shot and injured a 16 year old.

actor1: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Banyindu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mtetezi Militia
notes: 09 May 2019. Communal clashes continued between the Ngumino and the Banyindu and Bafuliru (in alliance with or under the leadership of Mtetezi) in the Tanganyika region of Fizi and neighboring Minembwe. During the clashes, the villages of Kamombo, Kabara, Oma, and Alumya (no coordinates available) were burned. Many locals were displaced by the communal violence following the murder of a Banyindu chief on 04/05.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 08 May 2019. An unidentified armed group, reportedly with support from a South Sudanese militia, attacked the FARDC in Muganga, Ituri (no coordinates available in proximity to Lake Albert). At least two soldiers were killed, while some sources indicated five.

Police forces fired warning shots and captured some of the escapees. On 10/05, three prisoner bodies were discovered nearby, suspected of being killed during the escape. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 08 May 2019. A suspected Mayi Mayi militia launched an attack in Butembo, reportedly in an attempt to free a captured combatant at a local hospital. The attackers killed one police officer who was guarding the facility. The FARDC responded and clashed with the attackers. The military reported seven fatalities on the attackers side, while city officials reported a dozen.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 May 2019 (on or before). An angry mob burned two suspected criminals alive in Karuba, Masisi. [size=no report]

actor1: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 May 2019. An unidentified armed group, consisting of approximately 100 fighters, attacked Blukwa, Djugu (some sources report the attack occurred in the Lea village). The FARDC contingent in the town was outnumbered and did not engage the attackers. The assailants killed at least two children (some sources report three). They also burned five homes, killed livestock, and pillaged the village. MONUSCO forces intervened and repelled the attackers.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

The military reported the attackers were the same group, which had attached Tshabi, Ituri.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 04 May 2019. The ADF attacked Mulango (no coordinates available, located south of Irumu). According to witnesses, the assailants injured civilians and looted property. They also abducted an unspecified number of civilians.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 04 May 2019. A soldier, who was responsible for guarding an estate owned by Kabila in Mbobero, Kabare (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map), shot and killed a civilian while attempting to extort him.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 25 April 2019 (on or before). Transom employees demonstrated in Bunia against questionable practices and financial management of the company. Police detained and assaulted three journalists covering the demonstration. [size=no report]

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 25 April 2019. Mayi Mayi Simba clashed with police in Mambelenga, Irumu (no coordinates available) after an earlier altercation between police and a driver in the area. One police officer was killed and four civilians were injured.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 24 April 2019. Health professionals demonstrated in Butembo against violence targeting the Ebola response. [size=dozens]

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 24 April 2019. Students in Butembo demonstrated, calling for the resignation of the management committee of the ISEAVF institution. [size=no report]

actor1: Pygmy Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Eco-Guards
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 24 April 2019. After the murder of pygmy the day prior, a group of pygmies armed with machetes and traditional weapons attacked two Eco-Guards in Bumoga (aka Cifunzi), Kalehe, who were unarmed and in civilian clothing. One of the Eco-Guards was killed but the FARDC and other Eco-Guards responded and intervened to save the other.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 April 2019. The military seized PKM ammunition, which farmers discovered buried in their fields in Otomabere, Irumu (no coordinates available).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 23 April 2019 (on or before). The FARDC Sokola II operation advanced to Magunda, Mwenga in their pursuit of FNL and FOREBU forces. Locals worry that the military is pushing the armed groups further into Mwenga.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Eco-Guards

notes: 23 April 2019. Kahuzi-Biega park rangers killed a pygmy man in Cifunzi, Kalehe.

actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: 22 April 2019. The FNL ambushed a bus in Kahwizi (aka Muhungu), as it was traveling from Bukavu to Uvira. The assailants assaulted the driver and looted the passengers. They also set the bus, as well as a civilian's motorcycle on fire.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 22 April 2019. An unidentified armed group abducted approximately six people in Kahunga, Rutshuru. Most of the abductees were reportedly women. The body of a male abductee, with bullet wounds, was discovered the following day.

actor1: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
notes: 22-25 April 2019. Approximately 200 FNL-Nzabampema combatants were observed in the mountain ranges of Kamombo, Karumyo, and Nyarusanze of Fizi.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 22 April 2019. A Mayi Mayi group ambushed an FARDC convoy along the Fizi-Mwenga road, near Kakamba, Fizi (no coordinates available).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo); Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
notes: 22 April - 06 May 2019. Prisoners took control of the central prison of Kananga and refused access to guards and administrators into the facility. During the night of 06/05, an unknown number escaped the prison, including Kamonia Nsapu elements. The suspects on trial for the murder of the UN experts were also among the escapees. Those who remained continued to prevent prison officials from entering the facility. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Angola)
notes: 22 April 2019. Angolan military forces entered Kiphese, Lukula (no coordinates available). The security forces were searching for FLEC rebels. During their incursions, which occurred at least twice during April, the forces detained at least four people who they took back to Angola.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 21 April 2019. A Lendu militia attacked an FARDC base in Djugu. Six militia members and four soldiers were killed during the clashes which lasted two hours.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 21 April 2019 (on or before). A soldier raped a pregnant woman in Katwa, Nyiragongo (no coordinates available). The perpetrator was arrested.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 21 April 2019. During the night, the FARDC intercepted an unidentified armed group as it approached their base in Jiro, Ituri. Four soldiers and one attacker were killed, although other sources report ten fatalities. Approximately $9,000 was also stolen by the combatants.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shabani)
notes: 21 April 2019. Raia Mutomboki Shabani and Raia Mutomboki Butachibera clashed in Ngokwe (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map), after a disagreement during a meeting between the armed groups. Three Shabani and four Butachibera combatants were killed.

notes: 21 April 2019. Raia Mutomboki Donat, Ngandu, and Mabala held a meeting. Following the meeting, the groups looted Kibilu, Shabunda. The armed group abducted 10 men as porters.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 20 April 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked an Ebola center in Katwa, Butembo. Security forces thwarted the attack, capturing at least one assailant (some sources indicated five) and killing another.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 20 April 2019. Soldiers began firing their weapons in Demba around the territorial administration building, following the death of one of their colleagues due to overconsumption of alcohol (the soldiers suspected he was poisoned).

actor1: Bosonalongo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bosozaya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 April 2019. Following the ruling on a land dispute between the Bosonalongo and Bosozaya villages in the Kungu territory, a group of Bosonalongo residents armed with traditional weapons attacked Bosozaya, Kungu (no coordinates available) and clashed with local residents. Three Bosozaya were seriously injured and one Bosonalongo attacker was slightly injured. The attackers burned 43 homes, two schools, and destroyed agricultural fields.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 20 April 2019. Protesters demonstrated in front of the Airtel office in Butembo, over the communication company's service quality. Police arrested the demonstrators. [size=9]

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 20 April 2019. An FARDC patrol attacked the Raia Mutombi Walike, after they looted Tchankindo (coordinates not known).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Walike)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Cameroon); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Cameroon); WHO: World Health Organization
notes: 19 April 2019. A suspected Mayi Mayi group attacked the Catholic University of Graben's Clinic in Butembo, which operates as part of the WHO's Ebola response. The assailants killed a Cameroonian doctor and burned a vehicle. According to a witness, the assailants claimed Ebola was not real and the doctors were killing people by claiming it was.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) National Intelligence Agency

actor1: Militia (Ditunga)
notes: 18 April 2019 (on or before). Kabue Ditunga (aka 'General'), who had voluntarily disarmed after the 2018 presidential elections, recruited five male youth in Kananga. Ditunga (who is armed), along with the youth, extort the civilian population of Kananga.

assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 18 April 2019 (on or before). Eco-Guards from the Okapi Reserve tortured two men, who they accused of illegally mining in the reserve. According to locals, the victims were traveling between Badengaido and Biakato, when they were falsely accused by the security forces.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Mayi Mayi militiamen killed a doctor in the University's clinic the next day (coded in separate event).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

notes: 16 April 2019 (on or before). The FARDC burned several houses and looted property in Kedza and Ndalo, Djugu (no coordinates available, in the Linga area). The attacks prompted residents of the areas to flee.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation

actor1: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: End of March - April. Over 12,000 people were displaced in the Kibele region of northern Beni (no coordinates available). Most of the IDPs fled to Kamango and Nobili, which can only be accessed through Uganda due to the insecurity of the region in DRC. Over 60,000 people have reportedly been displaced in North Kivu, particularly the Beni territory during the month of April. Some of the displaced are crossing into Uganda through informal crossings, bypassing immigration and health officials. Humanitarian actors are concerned about the spread of Ebola and access to assistance for those crossing informally.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 03 April 2019. ADF combatants abducted 36 civilians from Samboko, Irumu. The assailants also looted livestock. Four of the abductees, including a woman with a gunshot injury, managed to escape. The assailants released 13 hostages on 05/04, and instructed them to tell the FARDC that if they allow the militia to move freely in the area and access markets, the group will stop its attacks on the civilian population.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 03 April 2019. The ADF attacked the FARDC in Chani Chani (no coordinates available; located in Oicha). The attack was near Samboko, where they abducted civilians the same day.

She was later released after paying the group 10,000 CFCs.

The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

source: Twitter; Actualite; Radio Okapi; Kivu Security Tracker
notes: 21 March 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked Buhene (no coordinates available; located in the Nyiragongo territory on the border with Goma). Police attempted to repel the attackers. At least three people (some sources indicate five) were killed and three others abducted - the bodies of the abducted people were found two days later (abduction coded separately). The assailants reportedly came from and returned to Virunga National Park. Some sources indicate 10 people were abducted, five of whom were later killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The remaining 26 fatalities are spread between 8 events during the time period (one battle per week).

notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

Police intervened and fired shots to disperse the rioters, killing a passer-by and injuring one demonstrator. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 February - 08 March. The Twiganeho and Gumino militias (both are Banyamulenge) clashed with Mayi Mayi groups from the Bafuliru, Banyindu, and Babembe ethnic groups in the Minembwe region (between the borders of Mwenga and Fizi). Attacks were carried out on civilians in villages in the region, including lootings and the destruction of at least six villages. 27 fatalities were reported as a result of the inter-communal violence. The fatalities were spread across incidents including clashes and attacks on civilians.

Local civil society organizations indicated that the FARDC does not distinguish between civilians and militia members and has utilized the populations of Babuma and Bayelo villages to loot Lowa.

notes: 17 February. Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked a CENI warehouse and a residence owned by Kabila in Beni (unclear if in Beni town or territory). Police, military, and MONUSCO forces repelled the attackers.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 17 February. A soldier shot and killed another soldier in Ramba. The soldier had reportedly called the perpetrator a Rwandan.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 17 February. The FARDC forced civilians to carry their belongings as they relocated to Kitindi, Shabunda (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Lukoba)
notes: 17 February. The Raia Mutomboki Lukoba and Ndarumanga ambushed three motorcyclist outside of Nyombe, Shabunda. The assailants looted goods and forced six civilians to carry the goods.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 16 February. The ADF attacked a FARDC base in Masulikwede (coordinates are approximate, based on location 4 km east of Mavivi). Four soldiers were killed and six were wounded.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 16 February. NDC-Renove forces attacked the Mayi Mayi Kavumbi in Lwama, Masisi in an effort to gain control of the town.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 16 February. NDC-Renove forces attacked the Nyatura Jean Marie, between Lukweti and Nyange Bibwe, in Masisi.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 February. An unidentified armed group attacked the Mugunga and Majengo neighborhoods of Goma. The attackers killed six civilians. A military uniform was later discovered near Virunga National Park where the assailants fled after the attack.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 February. An unidentified armed group (believed to be the same group which attacked Goma town) killed two civilians in the Nyiragongo territory. After the attacks the group reportedly fled into Virunga National Park.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
notes: 16 February. The FARDC attacked the FNL Nzabampema in Busisi, Uvira (no coordinates available). Six militia members were killed. The FARDC also burned down their homes.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01-28 February. 58 women and one child experienced conflict-related sexual violence in the DRC during the month of February. Coded as one attack per week.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. FARDC forces, on the Congo River bank outside of Lowa, Tsopo fired at Mayi Mayi Mesandu forces, who took control of Lowa a few days prior.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
assoc_actor_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Jean-Marie Faction
notes: 15 February. The NDC-Renove clashed with APCLS and Nyatura-Jean Marie forces in Hembe, Masisi (coordinates are approximate based on OCHA map). Five combatants were killed and six people were wounded, including three civilians.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. Angry residents attacked a hand washing station - a part of the Ebola response - in Mambasa, Ituri. The residents opposed the Ebola vaccination campaign and were angry that locals were not hired as part of the response. Soldiers and police responded by firing into the air to disperse the group. A woman was injured by a stray bullet.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 February. Residents of Masisi and Nyabiondo protested calling for the restoration of security in the region and the resumption of medical services by MSF - who suspended activities in the region after staff members were temporarily abducted.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 February. Artisanal miners protested in Rubaya and Gakombe (no coordinates available) against a reduction in their salaries.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. The FARDC killed two ADF leaders - Kibuye Kajuju (aka Kadjadju and Canada) and Richard Mugisa (aka MTM)- in Mamove, Oicha.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Reunion)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. 25 Mayi Mayi Reunion members voluntarily disarmed at the FARDC base in Mboko. Another 14 Mayi Mayi combatants surrendered to the FARDC on the 17th in Lusambo, Fizi.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru)
notes: 15 February. Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru attacked Rumondo, Kalehe and abducted four boys.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: February (month of), an unidentified armed group abducted four girls between 4 and 7 years old from Kajuchu, Kabare (no coordinates available). Three days after their abduction their bodies were found, with their genitals removed.

actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: 14 February. FNL rebels ambushed two buses in Kagunga, Uvira. Two people were killed and 14 were injured.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 14 February. Residents of Rwangoma and LUCHA members protested, calling for increased security and the release of those abducted during the 07/02 attacks on the town.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mbulu)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 14 February. The FARDC attacked the Mayi Mayi Mbulu near Ngendo, Uvira (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The military killed three militia members and freed a hostage (who was abducted by the group on 11/02).

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 13 February. ADF combatants killed three civilians traveling to Mamove, on the Oicha-Mamove road.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 13 February. At least 200 nurses and health care workers from the Uvira territory gathered in Bukavu to demand over-due benefits.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
notes: 13 February (on or before). Disarmed Nsapu militia members occupied the Kamako primary school and imposed taxes and arbitrary arrests on the civilian population in Kamako.

actor1: Bakeka Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bakeka Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 February. A clash occurred in Mituku-Bamoya (no coordinates available, located in the Ubundu territory) between supporters of the new Bakeka groupment leader and supporters of the old leader. The clash resulted in several wounded from machetes.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 12 February. A soldier killed a civilian in Kibongo (no coordinates available), near Nyamilima, after the civilian refused to transport the soldier's belongings.

actor1: Civilians (South Sudan)
notes: 12 February (on or before). Over the course of a few days, approximately 5,000 refugees fleeing violence in South Sudan crossed into Congolese villages along the border, near Ingbokolo.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mesandu)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 12 February. Mayi Mayi Mesandu forces seized control of Lowa, Tshopo forcing the FARDC to withdraw from the city. Most of the civilian population also fled.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 February. A Batwa militia attacked Amiko (no coordinates available; in the Bendera region). The group looted the village and abducted women, who they took into the bush to rape. The abductees were later released.

actor1: CCU: United Congolese Convention
assoc_actor_2: FCC: Common Front for Congo; CCU: United Congolese Convention
notes: 12 February. Justin Omookala, of the CCU, held a governorship campaign march in Lusambo, Sankuru. Youth from the FCC opposition threw rocks at the CCU members. Some sources indicate that the groups began street fighting and the police intervened with live ammunition, killing one and injuring others. However, other sources reported that Justin Omookala's bodyguard shot at the opposition, resulting in the death and injuries.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Eco-Guards
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 February. An unidentified armed group attacked national park guards in Museya, Beni. The guards, along with the FARDC, repelled the attackers, killing two.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January - 02 April: The FARDC launched operations against the Mayi Mayi Simba in the Babila Babombi and Bombo communes of Mambasa territory. 38 Mayi Mayi Simba were killed during the period. 12 are coded in Mapendano on 01/03. The remaining 26 fatalities are spread between 8 events during the time period (one battle per week).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 11 February. The ADF attacked an FARDC position in Mamove, Beni. The rebels also looted the town and attempted to abduct civilians. Local civil society organizations report four rebels killed and four abductees freed. The military reported a dozen rebel fatalities (coded at lowest estimate).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 February. Local residents in Mavono, Butembo set fire to the Ebola health center in the town. Reasons unclear.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: 11 February. FDLR-RUD combatants abducted a man from Mirumba, Rutshuru (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants demanded a ransom.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
notes: 11 February. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted two people from Nyamugali, Uvira. The assailants demanded a ransom of $2,500.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mbulu)
notes: 11 February. Mayi Mayi Mbulu abducted a man from Ngendo, Uvira (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants demanded a $2,000 ransom.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 09 February (on or around). During the weekend, FARDC forces destroyed a rebel training center in the Wango forest, near Largu. The attack was part of an operation against the group operating in the Djugu territory. Six rebels were killed during the three hours of clashes.

assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Central African Republic)

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 09 February. LRA attacked civilians near Bulumasi, Bas Uele. They killed a man from CAR and abducted 12 civilians, including three women and two children. The abductees, with the exception of one of the boys were released on 11/02.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 08 February. The ADF killed four people, including a child, near Kudukudu, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. An unidentified armed group attacked Mundiba. The group killed one elderly man and injured his wife. The perpetrators also set four houses on fire.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kokodikoko)
notes: 08 February 2019. Raia Mutomboki- Kokodikoko attacked Kabikokole, Mwenga (coordinates are approximate). The assailants reportedly raped 100 women. They also looted the town and burned a health center.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

notes: 07 February. An armed group (likely the ADF due to the presence of children and women within the armed group) attacked Rwangoma. The FARDC reportedly repelled the attackers but residents reported hearing gunfire into the next morning. At least four civilian fatalities were reported (other sources indicated seven). The attackers also looted civilian property and abducted four adults and four children. The body of one of the abductees was found near Bwerera a few days later. The five civilian fatalities are recorded separately.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. ADF combatants attacked the FARDC in the Mbua Kamango region.

assoc_actor_2: Teachers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 February. Students at the University of Kisangani, who rioted over the arrest of two students the day prior, continued to destroy property. The students attacked professor's homes and property. One woman was reportedly assaulted by the rioters.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. LUCHA members demonstrated in Goma against a barrier at the port. Police intervened and arrested seven demonstrators.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 February (on or around). The corpse of a woman was found in Ariwara, Ituri. The victim's genitals had been removed. Some locals believe the genitals were removed for ritualistic purposes.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 January. During the night, a girl was tortured and raped in the Bankoko neighborhood of Bunia. She died the following day. Some locals attribute this crime to the release of militant prisoners at the end of December.

The FARDC reportedly repelled the attackers (clash coded separately) but residents reported hearing gunfire into the next morning. At least four civilian fatalities were reported (other sources indicated seven). The attackers also looted civilian property and abducted four adults and four children - the body of one of the abductees was found near Bwerera a few days later.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 06 February. University of Kisangani students demonstrated calling for the release of two students arrested in a murder case. The demonstrators burned school and teacher vehicles.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 05 February (on or before). A soldier was attacked with machetes by an unidentified group in Rwangoma.

notes: 05 February. The FARDC was deployed to the Kigoma region of Uvira in response to the presence of Red TABARA. Upon learning of the deployment, the armed group fled the area and the FARDC has reestablished government control of the region.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

notes: 05 February. FARDC forces attacked three Mayi Mayi Charles combatants in Buramba, Rutshuru. One Mayi Mayi member was killed and weapons were seized.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

notes: 04 February. Residents of the Keshero neighborhood of Goma caught a robber and police intervened to prevent the mob from attacking the robber. One police officer opened fire on the crowd of locals trying to disperse the mob, killing a teenage girl and injuring two male youths.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 February. Firefighters protested in Kinshasa over the government's failure to pay their salaries for 38 months.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 02 February. The ADF attacked the FARDC in the Boikene neighborhood of Beni. The FARDC repelled the attack. One soldier was killed.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 02 February. Two journalists covering a Lamuka rally were assaulted and injured by Lamuka supporters.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 02 February. Following clashes against the Mayi Mayi Mazembe, the FARDC looted civilian property in Kanyatsi, Lubero. The soldiers also raped a girl.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 02 February. UPLC combatants opened fire on a home in Kitokolu, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). Two men were killed and one was injured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01-28 February. 58 women and one child experienced conflict-related sexual violence in the DRC during the month of February. Coded as one attack per week.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 01 February. Throughout the night, the APCLS clashed with Guidon's NDC-Renove in Bwenderu and Butsindo (no coordinates available for the villages, located in the Bashali-Mokoto groupment). Two APCLS and three NDC-Renove fighters were killed.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 01 January. Residents of Kindu demonstrated against increased insecurity in the city, following the murder of a merchant the day prior. The demonstrators suspect police forces are behind the insecurity and attacked the Kindu police station. Police forces responded with tear gas and live ammunition. Two students were shot, according to Radio Okapi they were killed while Actualite reported they were injured. The demonstrators also attacked a radio station, where a police officer was hiding. Military forces were deployed to restore order.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 28 January- 03 February. During the week, three soldiers were killed in the Kakombe area of Uvira by unidentified assailants.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 January- 03 February. During the week, the FARDC carried out operations against LRA and other armed groups in the Dungu territory. Eight camps were destroyed in Dungu and Niangara during the operations.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 January- 03 February. During the week, the FARDC carried out operations against LRA and other armed groups in the Niangara territory. Eight camps were destroyed in Dungu and Niangara during the operations.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 January- 03 February. During the week, a 14 year-old girl was killed in Kiliba, Uvira by unidentified perpetrators.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 28 January- 03 February. During the week, a soldier shot a woman in Mutarule, Uvira. Unclear if she was killed or wounded.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Blaise)
notes: 01 February. Raia Mutomboki Blaise combatants abducted three men and one woman from Mihanda, Kabare (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 February. An unidentified armed group stabbed a soldier in Musienene, Lubero (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants stole the soldier's weapon.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: First half of February. The NDC-Renove imposed taxes and subjected civilians to forced labor in the towns of Luibo and Lukweti, Masisi - which the group occupies.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 31 January. The FARDC attacked UPLC bases in Pabuka and Kalingathi. Approximately 20 rebels and two soldiers were killed in the operation (coded as 11 fatalities per location). Weapons were also seized.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 31 January. The FARDC attacked UPLC bases in Pabuka and Kalingathi (no coordinates available; located south-east of Beni town). Approximately 20 rebels and two soldiers were killed in the operation (coded as 11 fatalities per location). Weapons were also seized.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Niyonzimana Faction
assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 31 January. The Nyatura FDP (Niyonzimana Faction) abducted and tortured six men from their fields near Burambo, Rutshuru (coordinates are approximate based on OCHA map). The victims were targeted after they failed to pay a fee to the militia. One of the men died from his injuries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 31 January. An unidentified armed group killed a merchant in Kindu.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 31 January. An unidentified armed group attempted to steal livestock near the Kinanira neighborhood of Sange. The FARDC repelled the attackers.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 31 January. After repelling an armed group from the area near the Kinanira neighborhood in Sange, the FARDC looted the local community.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 31 January. SONAS employees protested in Kinshasa over their outstanding salaries.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Rene)
notes: 31 January. Mayi Mayi Rene forces abducted a man from Kigongo, Uvira. The assailants demanded a ransom.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 31 January. The FARDC attacked an APCLS site in Buabo, Masisi (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The APCLS repelled the military forces back to Masisi center. A child was injured during the clashes.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 31 January. An unidentified armed group killed a man in Orac, Uvira (no coordinates available).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Rene)
notes: 31 January. Mayi Mayi Rene forces abducted a woman from Nakiliba, Uvira (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Ebu Ela)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 30 January. Ebuela wa Seba, leader of the Mtetezi militia, and 300 members of the armed group surrendered in Mikenge. The group cited the change of the ruling party as the reason for their voluntary disarmament.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 30 January. The FARDC clashed with APCLS forces in Kalihe and Lwanguba (no coordinates available; both villages are located in Masisi).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 30 January. A military site in Kahira was attacked by a Nyatura group.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 January (on or around). The FARDC clashed with LRA forces in Niangara, killing five rebels. One soldier was also killed during the clashes, but it is unclear if he was killed in Niangara or Dungu - where clashes also occurred - (the soldier's fatality was included in the Dungu fatalities).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 January (on or around). The FARDC clashed with LRA forces in Dungu, killing four rebels. One soldier was also killed during the clashes, but it is unclear if he was killed in Niangara or Dungu - where clashes also occurred - (the soldier's fatality was included in the Dungu fatalities).

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 January. In conjunction with their three day strike, TRANSCO employees in Kinshasa protested for their over due salaries and called for the resignation of the general manager of the company.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 30 January. LRA combatants ambushed five civilians 7 km south of Limai. The attackers looted goods from the civilians and abducted three men.

actor1: Chokwe Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Luba Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 January (on or around). Chokwe members attacked and injured a Luba man in the Kamonia territory. The attack was related to post-election communal tensions.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 January. An unidentified group abducted seven people from Kalengera. Three escaped, while the perpetrators are demanding a ransom for the others.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 29 January. NDC-Renove fighters clashed with Nyatura Nzayi in Lwama, in Bashali. Four Nzayi members, three NDC-R members and three civilians were killed during the clashes.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 29 January. The APCLS clashed with Bohoza's Nyatura fighters in Mipfungulu and Kise (no coordinates available for either location) in the Masisi territory. Four Bohoza fighters and two APCLS fighters were killed during the clashes.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 January. University students in Lubumbashi continued their demonstrations, and barricaded access to the University of Lubumbashi.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 January. Angry residents in Mubambiro burned military barracks to protest harassment by soldiers and insecurity.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 January. An unidentified armed group looted Loa Numbi, Kalehe. The assailants forced a man, a woman and three boys to carry the stolen property. No indication if they were released after.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January - 02 April: The FARDC launched operations against the Mayi Mayi Simba in the Babila Babombi and Bombo communes of Mambasa territory. 38 Mayi Mayi Simba were killed during the period. 12 are coded in Mapendano on 01/03. The remaining 26 fatalities are spread between 8 events during the time period (one battle per week).

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January. Lokondo Luakatebua, Mubiayi Dewayi, and Mwamba Musolo- three high ranking leaders of the Kamwina Nsapu militia, along with 60 other members, surrendered in Luebo. This comes as much of the Kamwina Nsapu Militia has turned in their arms following the election of Tshisekedi.

actor1: Militia (Mbawu Nkanka)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January. 43 members of the Mbawu Nkanka militia voluntarily disarmed in Tshikala.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January. Students of the Institute of Technical Applications in Kinshasa protested over the increase of fees. Police responded and dispersed the demonstrators.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 January. Lubumbashi University students continued their demonstrations over access to water and electricity on campus, as well as university fees. They barricaded roads, blocked access to the university, and burned tires.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 January. Students of the Institute of Superior Pedagogy (ISP) in Bukavu demonstrated against school and syllabus fees. The students burned tires and barricaded roads.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 January. An unidentified armed group robbed an ambulance and abducted the driver from the Lubero General Hospital, near Itolero (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker Map). The assailants demanded a $5,000 ransom.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 28 January. An unidentified armed group attacked a FARDC vehicle, near Kacungwe, Fizi (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The soldiers pursued the perpetrators. One soldier was injured.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 28 January. LRA combatants looted two travelers 11 km northeast of Bilikwa, Haut-Uele. They also looted another traveler 6 km northeast of Bilikwa. The assailants held the men hostage for a few hours before releasing them.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Malaika)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 27 January 2019. 46 Mayi Mayi Malaika combatants, including five children, and 10 other dependents voluntarily surrendered to the FARDC in Samba, Maniema.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: 27 January. An unidentified armed group abducted six people in Mubambiro, including two ICRC employees. The perpetrators also killed an infant, while they abducted the mother.

actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 27 January. Following clashes between the Imbonerakure and Red TABARA, one of the armed groups looted the civilian population in Murambi (no coordinates available), near Kiryama (coordinates are approximate based on WFP map). Much of the local population fled into the forest.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: 27 January. Imbonerakure clashed with Red TABARA in Murambi, near Kiryama (coordinates are approximate based on WFP map). Eight fatalities were reported and several civilians were injured. Red TABARA forces fled towards Kitoga.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 27 January. Students from the University of Lubumbashi demonstrated over water, electricity, and fees. The demonstrators barricaded roads, blocked access to the university, and burned tires and vehicles. Police forces opened fire on the demonstrators, killing three. A police officer also died after being hit by a police car.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 27 January. An armed group, who spoke Lingala and an unrecognized language, abducted a man 10 km west of Ngilima, Haut Uele. The abductee was released a few hours later. The group may have links to LRA as the event was reported by source tracking LRA activity.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 26 January (on or before). As the Kamwina Nsapu has begun disarming, members of the militia sought to disarm the police force in Nganza. The police fired into the air to repel the militia members.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 25-26 January. Two-day clashes between APCLS and NDC-Renove in Shimbisha (no coordinates available; near Lukweti). Three NDC-Renove fighters, one APCLS fighter, and one civilian were killed (fatalities spread across two events).

actor1: Banunu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 January (on or before). More than 50 mass graves were discovered in the Yumbi area. The graves are from the clashes that occurred between the Banunu and Batende in mid-December 2018.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: 26 January. Mayi Mayi raped three women in Kwebo (no coordinates available; located in the Masisi territory).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kokodikoko)
notes: 26 January. Raia Mutomboki Kokodikoko and Raia Mutomboki Ngandu looted Tachinid, Shabunda (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants killed a man during the attack.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 26 January. Approximately 600 Kamwina Nsapu militia members arrived in Kananga, for voluntary disarmament in exchange for economic support.

actor1: Luba Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 25 January 2019. A Luba group attempted to attack the home of a national assembly member in Tshikapa. The police intervened and repelled the attackers.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 25 January. FARDC forces clashed with a coalition of Mayi Mayi militias in the Bavira chiefdom in the Kalungwe area. The military repelled the militias and recovered weapons.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 25-26 January. Two-day clashes between APCLS and NDC-Renove in Shimbisha (no coordinates available; near Lukweti). Three NDC-Renove fighters, one APCLS fighter, and one civilian were killed (fatalities spread across two events).

actor1: Twa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 25 January. During the night, a group of Twa men from Ndubie looted Kiwete (no coordinates available), a Bantu village in Pweto. Residents of Kiwete and surrounding villages fled the area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 25 January. An unidentified armed group abducted a man from Muhani (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants demanded a $700 ransom.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Niyonzimana Faction
notes: 25 January. Nyatura Niyonzimana abducted one man from Karambi and looted his home.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 25 January. An unidentified armed group killed a man in Kitalaga, Kalehe (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 25 January. The FARDC clashed with Mayi Mayi Rene in Muheta, Uvira forcing the armed group to flee and capturing territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 25 January. After forcing the Mayi Mayi Rene out of Muheta, the soldiers looted civilian property.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 24 January. A Mayi Mayi group attacked soldiers based outside of Uvira city. Three soldiers were killed.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 24 January. NDC-Renove forces clashed with the Nyatura Nzayi in Nyabura (no coordinates available; located in the Bahali-Mokoto district).

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 24 January (on or before). ADF forces ambushed drivers on RN 4, in Kisiki-Mayimoya. Three people were killed, two were injured. Three Okapi vehicles were also intercepted but the drivers were not harmed.

actor1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_1: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: 24 January. Felix Tshisekedi was inaugurated as president of the DRC.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kihebe)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: 24 January. Red TABARA combatants clashed with Mayi Mayi Kihebe in Kishagala, Uvira (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map) at a bar. One Kihebe combatant and one civilian were killed, while one other civilian was wounded.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 24 January. The ADF ambushed an Okapi Logistics, NGO convoy near Kisiki. The assailants killed three and injured three during the robbery.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 24 January (on or before). The body of a murdered two-year old child was found in the Cikonyi neighborhood of Bukavu.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Mwenga Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 January. An armed group attacked the Ruvungi market in Burhini, killing five and seriously injuring two others. The perpetrators targeted gold buyers. Other sources indicated that the attacked occurred in the Kakwende village in Mwenga, and resulted in the death of five assailants, one soldier, and one civilian. This source also noted that the civilian population defended itself against the attackers.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kakule)
assoc_actor_2: Fishermen (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 January. Charles Kakule's militia abducted 30 fishermen on Lake Edward. Some of the abductees managed to escape, while the others were released following ransom payments.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 23 January. The UPLC abducted three members of MONUSCO in Kisalala. Shortly after the abduction, the FARDC freed the abductees.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 23 January. The military arrested Kamate Mungumwa and Muhindo Mbiriki, two leaders of the Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kirumba. The leaders were unarmed at the time of arrest.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 January. Prisoners in the Mbuji Mayi escaped through a tunnel. Guards opened fire on the inmates to prevent their escape. Some sources report five fatalities, while others indicate nine, including a prison guard.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 January. An unidentified armed group raided home and abducted a man in Mbuhi-Pilote.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Ngandu)
notes: 23 January. The Raia Mutomboki Mungoro clashed with the Raia Mutomboki Ngandu after the Ngandu group looted a cow and goats from Nguku, Walikale (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The Mungoro combatants recovered the stolen livestock.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 January. Three armed men tortured a woman in Rutare, Kalehe (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker). The woman died of her injuries.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Chuyi)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January 2019. The Mayi Mayi Chuyi ambushed an FARDC convoy along the road from Kabambare to Pene-Mende (35 km south of Kilembwe). One militia member was killed and three soldiers were injured.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kakule)
assoc_actor_2: Fishermen (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 22 January. Kakule's militia abducted 39 fishermen (other sources indicated 20) on Lake Edward.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21-22 January. Five civilians died during clashes in and around Luke between the FARDC and Nyatura Kasongo. Fatalities spread across two events.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January. The FARDC clashed with an armed group in Largu. The military reported three soldiers and five rebel fatalities. However, civil society has reported four military fatalities. Civil society reported the group looted arms from a military depot in town but the FARDC denied the report.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January. The FARDC clashed with the Simba militia in Dembele (coordinates are approximate based on reports that the village is 15-17 km from Nia Nia, along the Kisangani road). The groups leaders, Manu and Abley, were killed along with five other members of the militia.

actor1: Militia (Moise Tshiombe)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January. Moise Tshiombe's militia crossed paths with the FARDC in Demba, as the armed group was traveling to Kananga to disarm. The soldiers attempted to disarm the militia on the spot, sparking a clash between the groups. One soldier was killed. Much of the local population fled, fearing retaliation by the military.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 22 January. The Nyatura Bohoza faction clashed with the APCLS in Nyabyara and Luala (no coordinates available), near Kahira in Masisi. Four civilians and seven fighters were killed during the clashes.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Mayi Mayi Militia (Kihebe)
notes: 22 January. Imbonerakure clashed with Red TABARA, FNL and Mayi Mayi Kihebe in Kifuni (no coordinates available), in the Kigoma area. The Imbonerakure pushed the armed groups into the Kitavuka Mbegere forest. Movements of Burundi military forces and Imbonerakure were reported across the border into the Kigoma area of DRC the same day.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Buhirwa)
notes: 22 January. Mayi Mayi Buhirwa abducted a man from Narunanga, Uvira. The assailants demanded a $2,000 ransom.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 22 Jan 2019, a policeman shot and killed a woman in Butare village of Masisi territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An armed group shot at an Oxfam vehicle in Rutobogo (coordinates are approximate, based on location 2 km west of Sake) and raped two women. The driver escaped. The armed group then ambushed a motorbike, killing two riders, while one managed to escape. Locals indicated that this group is also responsible for abductions in the area but provided no further details.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 21 January. The LRA barricaded the Dungu-Doruma road at Kana village. They then abducted 15 people and looted property, food, and money.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21 January. The ADF attacked FARDC positions in Mapou. Additional forces were deployed to repel the ADF. Several fatalities were reported (unknown coded as 10).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21-22 January. Five civilians died during clashes in and around Luke between the FARDC and Nyatura Kasongo. Fatalities spread across two events.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 09-23 January (on or around). FARDC led two weeks of military operations against FDLR bases in Nord-Kivu, regaining key posts such as the FDLR base in Faringa, Bwito (Rutshuru). After Faringa was captured, fighting continued in Rubaya of Masisi as the FDLR fighters tried to retreat to Sud-Kivu. 10 fatalities during operations. Coded as two events per week, two in Faringa, two in Rubaya, with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21 January. Police dispersed Lamuka supporters who gathered at the MLC headquarters in Kinshasa to listen to Martin Fayulu.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An armed group (suspected to be the same that carried out attacks in Rutobogo earlier on the same day), attacked Kimoka during the night. The perpetrators raped two women, killed another, and wounded three men.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An unidentified group abducted two men from the Benengule neighborhood of Beni. The assailants tortured one of the abductees before releasing him. The man died of his injuries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. Two unidentified armed men killed an elderly woman in the Rukangaga area of Kiliba, Uvira.

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
notes: On 21 Jan 2019, the NDC Guidon attacked a Nyatura Nzayi position in Munongo village of Masisi territory. NDC Guidon militants chased Nyatura Nzayi fighters from their position. A man drowned during their escape.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 01-31 January 2019. During the month of January, FRPI, who were in the midst of peace negotiations, looted at least three villages in the Aveba and Geti areas. The assailants raped a 15 year-old girl during one of the attacks. Coded as three events at random points in January - two looting and one violence against civilians.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 20 January. Clashes between the NDC-Renove and Nyatura-Nzayi continued in Munongo Kakonse (no coordinates available, in the Mokoto district). Six people were killed including two civilians.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
notes: 20 January (on or around). The FARDC and Eco Guards clashed with the Kakule militia, securing the release of 39 hostages being held by the group.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 20 January. The LRA ambushed three people on bikes along the Nambia-Bagandi road in Mabadabada village (no coordinates available, located in the Niangara territory). The perpetrators seriously injured one and looted their belongings.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 20 January. NDC-Renove forces clashed with Nyatura-Nzayi in Kinyana, Masisi (no coordinates available). Five Nzayi combatants, one NDC-R fighter, and four civilians were killed.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shabani)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 09-23 January (on or around). FARDC led two weeks of military operations against FDLR bases in Nord-Kivu, regaining key posts such as the FDLR base in Faringa, Bwito (Rutshuru). After Faringa was captured, fighting continued in Rubaya of Masisi as the FDLR fighters tried to retreat to Sud-Kivu. 10 fatalities during operations. Coded as two events per week, two in Faringa, two in Rubaya, with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Twa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 17 January. An unidentified armed group ambushed a microbus near Mujangala, Walungu (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The perpetrators killed one man and injured another. The assailants also stole the passengers' belongings.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 17 January. An unidentified armed group looted homes and killed a woman in Buloli, Kabare (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 17 January. The LRA robbed a woman near Nabakpa, Haut Uele.

actor1: Walendu Pitsi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 17 January (on or around). 20 villages in the Ngakpa and Uketa (no coordinates available) areas of Djugu were looted and burned by a neighboring group from the Walendu Pitsi community. Over 1,500 homes in the area were destroyed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru)
notes: 15 January. The Raia Mutomboki Shukuru abducted three men from Kashewe, Kalehe. The assailants also looted live stock.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
