notes: 01 May 2019. The FARDC and FDLR clashed near Kakomero, Rutshuru (no coordinates available; in the Rugari area). Two soldiers were killed during the clashes.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 01 May 2019. After being ambushed by the FDLR earlier in the day, FARDC forces attacked the civilian population in Rugari. Six civilians, including three women, were killed in the retaliatory attack. The military denied the attacked but accused the local population of cooperating with the FDLR.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 01 May 2019. The FARDC and FDLR clashed in the Shoko valley, located in the Tongo groupment of Rutshuru.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 May 2019. An angry mob attacked illegal road barriers erected by police along the Kisangani-Banalia road and Kisangani-Opala road. The mob also destroyed 21 houses and offices of the traffic police. [size=no report]

actor1: Twa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 04 January 2019. A Twa militia attacked an FARDC site in Muhala, Tanganyika.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
notes: 04 January. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted two men near Bwesho (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.

actor1: Twa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03 January. An armed Twa militia ambushed a candidate from Kongolo's convoy on their way to Lubumbashi on the Kalemie-Kabwela-Pweto-Lubumbashi road. Two people were killed and another was injured.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Fimbo)
assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo); Civilians (China)
notes: 02 January. Mayi Mayi Fimbo na Fimbo Bitonto ambushed a company convoy near Mulange village. One person was killed and others were injured, including a Chinese employee of the company.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: 01 January (on or around). Nyatura forces established a base at Ngugo village (coordinates are appoximate based on OCHA map), in the Rutshuru territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: CENI: Independent National Electoral Committee
notes: 31 December. An unknown group set fire to three voting machines which were located at a CENI employee's home in Katanda.

actor1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 31 December. The government cut internet and SMS access across the country. They also cut the radio signal of RFI and revoked the press credentials of one of the outlets journalist after the station reported on preliminary election results. The restrictions were implemented to prevent the spread of rumors as the presidential election tallies are completed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 31 December. An unidentified armed group killed two women in Kasenga and stole their livestock.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: CENCO: National Episcopal Conference of Congo
notes: 31 December (on or around). Independent election observers from CENCO were prohibited by police from observing ballot counting in polling stations in Lubumbashi.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
notes: 31 December. The Nsabanga militia (a faction of Kamwina Nsapu) looted Kalulu village in Kasai Central (no coordinates available, in the Tshikula area).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: CENI: Independent National Electoral Committee
notes: 30 December. A CENI employee in Boma was attacked by a mob of voters when he went to replace a malfunctioning machine. The mob suspected him of bringing a fraudulent machine. Police intervened.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019); Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua); Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe); NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo; NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon); APCLS-M: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (Mapenzi); Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda; Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Domi Faction
notes: 30 December. Voter intimidation during the voting for the presidential elections reported in various areas of Nord-Kivu. Security forces interfered with voting at some polling locations in Mulimbi and Butare (Rutshuru) and Mutongo (Walikale). Armed groups also interfered: the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua for Shadary in Walikale territory; NDC and Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kasiki, Bunyatenge, Kinyatsi, and Mbwavinywa (Lubero); NDC-Guidon and APCLS Mapenzi for Shadary at polls in Mwendabandu ((Bukombo, Lwibo, Lushebere, Ngesha, Bugoye, Bushore, Bonde villages)) (Masisi territory). Meanwhile, Nyatura-FDLR coalition and Nyatura-Domi for Fayulu in polling sites in the Bwito region (Rutshuru).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Protests over problems with voting machines were "violently dispersed" in Inongo. Other sources indicate that voters ransacked a polling station. No indication if they were dispersed by police or military forces.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: CENI: Independent National Electoral Committee
notes: 30 December. Voters in Kananga assaulted a CENI employee who wanted to take one of the voting machines out of a polling station.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: CENI: Independent National Electoral Committee
notes: 30 December. A CENI employee was assaulted by a group of voters after he allowed candidate Bitika Pascal to enter a polling station in Kindu. Police intervened to stop the assault.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Voters at Tshiteku in Kinshasa clashed with police who would not allow them to vote after the polling station had closed. The voters were angry as they were late after receiving the incorrect polling station information from CENI.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Military forces clashed with a militia in Kakulu in Kasai (no coordinates available). One militia member was killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. Armed groups were observed interfering with polling in the Kasai territory.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: CENI: Independent National Electoral Committee
notes: 30 December. A mob of voters attacked a CENI employee who was trying to fix a machine in Mbandaka. The voters suspected the man of tampering with votes and injured him before the police intervened.

actor1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
assoc_actor_2: FCC: Common Front for Congo
notes: 30 December. UDPS gunmen assaulted FCC supporters to prevent them from voting at some polling stations in Kasai Oriental.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. Armed groups reportedly interfered with voting at some polling locations in the Shabunda territory.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. Clashes occurred between FCC supporters and opposition party supporters in Ditunda in Kasai (no coordinates available). The clash began as opposition election observers were prevented by CENI officials from entering polling stations. Seven people were seriously injured and voting was suspended in the town.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. After beating up a CENI employee, a mob of voters in Kananga clashed with police. The groups threw objects at each other. This resulted in the suspension of voting at the Sola Gratia school

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
notes: 30 December. Police and armed groups in Maniema prevented opposition supporters from going to polling stations during the voting for the presidential elections. Raia Mutomboki also interfered in Walowa Yu.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: FCC: Common Front for Congo
notes: 30 December. Voters in Mbandaka assaulted a FCC supporter who was trying to buy votes for Shadary. Police used tear gas to disperse the mob.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. A grenade exploded at a polling station in Mulo, one person was injured.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. After a police officer shot and killed a man, an angry mob in Walungu beat the officer to death. However, CENI stated the police officer was killed when voters suspected a CENI employee of tampering with voting machines.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Protests over problems with voting machines were "violently dispersed" in Inongo. No indication if they were dispersed by police or military forces.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Voters at the Lurhala school in Walungu became angry when a man in the polling center was urging others to vote for Shadary. A police opened fire to disperse the group, killing one man. The CENI president reported that a CENI technician was lynched by an angry mob because they thought he was tampering with a voting machine.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Protests occurred in Bulungu, Kwilu over corruption allegations against a politician. A soldier guarding the politician shot and killed a man. [size=no report]

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 29 December. The NDC Renove attacked Kashuga and nearby settlements. They attacked areas known for their support of political opposition figures, displacing many locals, which prevented them from voting the next day.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
notes: 29 December. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted three men near Bwesho (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 28 December. Demonstrations continued in various parts of Goma in response to CENI's postponement of voting in Beni, Butembo, and Yumbi. Police and Military dispersed the protesters with tear gas.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Fimbo)
notes: 28 December (on or around). Mayi Mayi Fimbo an Fimbo reportedly attacked eight villages in the Koki (no coordinates available) area, located in the Kalemie territory. A joint MONUSCO-humanitarian assessment mission to confirm the attacks and humanitarian need was unable to reach the area due to insecurity.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 28 December. APCLS looted motorbikes, money, and property in Kanyaminsindo (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Tracker map). They also abducted six men to carry the stolen goods.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 December. FARDC foiled an attempted kidnapping in the Kinanira neighborhood of Sange, killing one of the perpetrators.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 27 December. Demonstrations led by LUCHA continued in Beni against the postponement of elections in the region. The demonstrators burned tires and ransacked a Ebola facility, causing the patients to flee. The home of a police officer was also set on fire. Security forces fired to disperse the rioters. One demonstrator was killed, three police were injured, four LUCHA members were injured and 17 rioters were arrested.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 27 December. Angry over election delays in Beni, Butembo and Yumbi, demonstrators barricaded roads in Goma. Police utilized tear gas to disperse the demonstrators.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 27 December. An unidentified group looted Shanje (coordinates are approximate, based on Kivu Security map). They then abducted two men to carry the stolen property.

actor1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: EU: European Union
notes: 27 December. Following the renewal of EU sanctions on Congolese officials -including presidential candidate Shadary- the Congolese government expelled the EU ambassador to DRC.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 27 December (or after). Rioters, angry that CENI cited the Ebola outbreak as one of the reasons for postponing the election, caused property damage to an Ebola center in Mutwanga, Oicha. No further details available. [size=no report]

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 27 December (or after). Rioters, angry that CENI cited the Ebola outbreak as one of the reasons for postponing the election, caused property damage to an Ebola center in Bulongo, Oicha. No further details available. [size=no report]

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 27 December (or after). Rioters, angry that CENI cited the Ebola outbreak as one of the reasons for postponing the election, caused property damage to an Ebola center in Kisima, Beni. No further details available. [size=no report]

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 27 December (or after). Rioters, angry that CENI cited the Ebola outbreak as one of the reasons for postponing the election, caused property damage to an Ebola center in Lume, Beni (no coordinates available). No further details available. [size=no report]

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 26 December. Beni residents took to the streets to demonstrate against the postponement of elections in the territory. Military forces and police responded with tear gas and gun fire to disperse the protesters.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 26 December. Following the postponement of elections in Butembo, demonstrators barricaded the roads and burned tires. Police forces dispersed the demonstrators.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 26 December. The FARDC captured the second in command of Raia Mutomboki- Hamakombo faction, Isaac Cirhabissa, and three other rebels in Katubiro (no coordinates available), a village in the Kalima area.

actor1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 26 December. CENI announced the postponement of elections in Yumbi, Beni and Butembo until March 2019, citing insecurity and Ebola. The election schedule is set to remain the same for the rest of the country. Beni and Butembo were seen as strong-holds of the opposition parties.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 December. An unidentified gunman shot at a taxi near Kabasha, killing a passenger.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 25 December. An unidentified group killed a soldier and one civilian in the Rwangoma neighborhood of Beni.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: FCC: Common Front for Congo
notes: 25 December. Police fired live ammunition to disperse a group of FCC supporters who were fighting over different candidates. One person was injured.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 24 December. IDPs and locals in Nyabiondo protested insecurity in the region, which has disrupted humanitarian access to the displaced population.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 23 December (on or around). The Raia Mutomboki-Hamakombo militia attacked FARDC, killing two soldiers.

actor1: Banunu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 December. Three people were killed during clashes between the Banunu and Batende in Misele (no coordinates available). Communal clashes initially erupted between the groups in Yumbi on 18/12.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 December. Approximately 21 female prisoners in Beni escaped, the group included criminals and members of armed groups.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 December. An armed group shot and wounded a civilian on the opposite side of the Mbomou river, north of Zapai.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 December. Five people, including one soldier were killed in Kipriani. The attackers are suspected of belonging to the ADF, but wore FARDC uniforms. Goods and livestock from the town were also looted.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 22 Dec 2018, the ADF raided Masiani neighborhood of Beni city. The attackers killed an FARDC soldier, six adults and two children. They also wounded one adults and two children.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 21 December (on or before). LRA forces moved into Nango, where they are preventing the local population from leaving. The group is looting food goods from the village and forcing the youth to transport the looted goods for them.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 21 Dec 2018, a FARDC soldier shot dead a civilian man in Mamundioma locality of Beni territory. The victim had demanded the soldier to repay his debt to him.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 20 December. MONUSCO deployed additional peacekeepers throughout Beni and increased the number of patrols to provide additional security before the elections.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 December. Protesters demonstrated in front of the Belgian Embassy, against the extension of EU sanctions against presidential candidate Ramazani Shadary.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 December. An armed group set fire to 15 homes in Kabere and looted livestock from the village. Some suspect that Red-Tabbara was responsible, but the group denied responsibility and argued that Imbonerakure carried out the attack along with Mayi Mayi Kivangila.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 December. Students at the University of Kinshasa protested, demanding elections happen as scheduled.

actor1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 19 December. The government in Kinshasa banned all campaign rallies and events in the city four days before the presidential election. This came as the Lamuka Coalition was set to hold a meeting in the city. Police forces also blocked Lamuka presidential candidate Martin Fayulu's convoy in Nsele to prevent him from entering Kinshasa city later on.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 19 December. Rodrigue Ndakazieka, a journalist from Radio Mwinda (owned by a member of the Lamuka Coalition) was detained by police who provide security to Antoinette Ipulu, the National Deputy of the FCC. The police brought the journalist to the politician's house, where they beat him for several hours. He was later taken to a police station in Kinshasa.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 19 December. In response to Fayulu's prevention from entering Kinshasa, Lamuka members burned tires in the street and barricaded the road. Police responded with tear gas and shots were heard.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: AFDC: Alliance of Democratic Forces of Congo
notes: 19 December. A police guard traveling with AFDC candidate Mbengele, injured a man in Shokombenge.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
notes: 19 December. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali killed a man in Bwegera and seriously injured his wife.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Refugees/IDPs (Burundi)
notes: 19 December (on or before). Burundian refugees in Lusenda were prohibited from leaving the refugee camp as a security measure before the elections in DRC.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 19 December. An armed group ambushed and killed two men on bicycles and another man on a motorbike, near Samatari.

actor1: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
assoc_actor_2: AFDC: Alliance of Democratic Forces of Congo
notes: 19 December. After a police guard affiliated with the AFDC injured a man in Shokombenge, armed PPRD supporters attacked Mbengele's motorcade and burned the homes of 20 AFDC supporters. At least one person was injured.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 19 Dec 2018, the ADF shot and killed three civilians near Kelekele town in Beni territory. The bodies of the victims were found half a kilometer from an FARDC position.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 18 December. An unidentified armed group abducted three people near Kibumba. They then fled with the abductees into Virunga National Park.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 18 December. Three men on a motorcycle were ambushed and killed at km 5 on the Mbau-Kamango road by ADF forces.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 18 December. An unidentified group killed five people in Sake.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
notes: 18 December. The PPRD office in Tshikapa was ransacked. The identity of the perpetrators is unknown, but Tshisekedi supporters are suspected.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 18 December. Locals in Tshikapa demonstrated against a scheduled visit to the city by Shadary. Police struggled to control the crowd and fired live ammunition to disperse the demonstrators, killing one woman and injuring two others.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 18 December. After security forces used live ammunition to disperse an anti-Shadary protest in Tshikapa, demonstrators tried to burn down police offices.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
assoc_actor_2: ADRP: Alliance of Democrats for Renewal and Progress
notes: 18 December. An ADRP campaign in Ubundu was attacked by PPRD members who threw objects at the ADRP supporters. Two people were injured.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shabani)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 18 December. An FARDC convoy was ambushed by Raia Mutomboki Shabani forces near Bubare (approximate coordinates based on humanitarian map). One soldier was killed and two others were abducted.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 18 December. An unidentified group attacked Lubao, firing their weapons and looting a money transfer agency. Police near the CENI offices exchanged fire with the attackers, causing them to flee.

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Banunu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: Radio Okapi; UN HRC; AFP; MONUSCO
notes: 17 December. Following the attack on Yumbi city on 16/12, suspected Batende militia members attacked Bongende, Yumbi. The assailants mutilated the victims, removing limbs and sexual organs of men, women and children. Fetuses were cut out of pregnant women. At least one woman was raped and two children were reportedly abducted. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed 348 fatalities in Bongende, however, they suspected the actual number to be higher. Investigations found that the attacked on the Banunu were likely planned in advance and soldiers participated in the attacks on Bongende.

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Naval Forces
source: Radio Okapi; UN HRC; AFP; MONUSCO
notes: 17 December. Suspected Batende militia members attacked Nkolo 2, a Banunu community. Two naval officers attempted to repel the attackers, but one of the soldiers was killed and the other is missing. Much of the Nkolo 2 population had fled following the Yumbi city attack on 16/12. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed at least 10 fatalities in Nkolo 2. Homes, churches and schools were destroyed. Investigations found that the attacked on the Banunu were likely planned in advance.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Ndarumanga)
notes: 17 December. Raia Mutomboki-Ndarumanga attacked Bisangani (coordinates are approximate; based off of Kivu Security Tracker map). The perpetrators looted livestock and abducted locals (four people from Bisangani and Kibumba).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Ndarumanga)
notes: 17 December. Raia Mutomboki-Ndarumanga attacked Kibumba. The group looted livestock and abducted a total of four people from Kibumba and Bisangani, which they also attacked.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 17 December. The FARDC, with support from MONUSCO, responded to the ADF attack on Mangboko and repelled the attackers.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 17 December. ADF forces attacked Mangboko village on road 4. One truck driver was ambushed and shot. Homes were also destroyed.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: 14 - 21 December. A Mayi Mayi group has moved into Masumo, where they are taxing the local population.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 17 December. The FARDC and FDLR continued to clash near the Mikeno volcano in Virunga National Park. Two soldiers were killed during the clashes (recorded as one fatality per day).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Ndarumanga)
notes: 17 December. Twelve members of Raia Mutomboki- Ndarumanga attacked Kibumba and Bisangani (coordinates are approximate for Bisangani based on Kivu Tracker map). They looted livestock and abducted four people.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 17 December. An unidentified armed group attacked FARDC forces near Barara (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). Five soldiers were killed and seven were injured.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
notes: 17 December. The AARC and PPRD (both members of the FCC) clashed in Ubundu, after the PPRD members prevented an AARC candidate from accessing his house. Five people were seriously injured in the clash

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Ndarumanga)
notes: 17 December. Twelve members of Raia Mutomboki- Ndarumanga attacked Kibumba and Bisangani (coordinates are approximate for Bisangani based on Kivu Tracker map). They looted livestock and abducted four people.

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Banunu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: Radio Okapi; UN HRC; AFP; MONUSCO
notes: 17 December. Following the communal attacks in Yumbi, suspected Batende militia members attacked Banunu members in Camp Nbanzi (no coordinates available; 70 km from Yumbi). At least seven people were killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-); Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 17 Dec 2018, unidentified gunmen attacked a World Food Program convoy near Lwashi village in Masisi territory. The attackers killed one man and kidnapped two others. They also stole goods.

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Banunu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: Radio Okapi; UN HRC; AFP; MONUSCO
notes: 16 December. A group of 3,000 armed Batende attacked Yumbi city - particularly the neighborhoods of Noyi, Bolu, Likolo, and Ntsentseke. Local police members participated along the Batende (the head of the police had disarmed Banunu officers prior to the attack). Armed Banunu members retliated in some areas with support from a member of the naval forces. Civilians were shot, stabbed, mutilated, and burned to death; over 900 properties were damaged including homes, schools and churches. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed 170 fatalities, primarily from the Banunu community (the number may be higher due to uncounted bodies dumped into the river). The attack came after a communal dispute over the burial of the Banunu's customary chief on land belonging to Batende on 14/12. Local CSOs indicate that the group's political allegiances of the Batende with the FCC and Banunu with the Lamuka Coalition exacerbated the dispute.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 11 December. Lamuka coalition supporters and police clashed in Lubumbashi amidst Fayulu's arrival for a campaign rally. Police fired tear gas and water cannons at supporters who had gathered around the city, including at Fayulu's motorcade. Fayulu's supporters burned vehicles. Police said they dispersed the Lamuka supporters for burning vehicles, while Fayulu's speakers report the police initiated it to prevent the Lamuka rally. Civil society organizations report at least one death by shooting (possibly two) and 43 injuries , while the police reported 13 injuries and denied any fatalities. The UN HRC reported three fatalities and several injuries.

notes: On November 26, in Ruashi town (Lubumbashi, Katanga), residents staged a protest against the lack of electrical power for several days by barricading roads and burning tires. Congolese police intervened to disperse the population and restore public order.

actor1: Government of United States
notes: On November 26, in Kinshasa city, the US embassy in DR Congo closed over a terror threat.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (1997-2001)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On November 25, in Kananga city (Kananga, Kasai-Occidental), military forces seized 17 AK47 rifles, two 12 caliber, 950 ammunition and a pair of goggles, as well as arrested all the people from whom these weapons were seized and we put them at the disposal of the military justice.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On Nov 24, a taxi driver died and his client was injured after an attack by the ADF in Beni-Boikene in the Ruwenzori Commune. The rebels took away several domestic animals.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 23 November. Suspected members of the ADF ambushed a MONUSCO patrol in North Kivu. One peacekeeper was injured.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On November 22, near Kamango town (Oicha, Nord-Kivu), a helicopter from the UN mission was shot by Ugandan Muslim rebel (ADF) fire. There were no reported fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) National Intelligence Agency; Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 November - 21 December. State security forces arbitrarily arrested 271 people during campaign related activities and demonstrations across the country. Of the arrests, 172 occurred in North Kivu. Coded as four events, one per week during the period.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Nov 21, police clashed with supporters of opposition leader Martin Fayulu Madidi upon his return to Kinshasa. Stones were thrown and four vehicles damaged by the supporters.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 20, three political activists were killed by unknown armed men while canvassing for DR Congo's pro-government presidential candidate Emmanuel Ramazani Shadary.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 November. An armed group with AK 47's ambushed three men on a motorcycle in Lika. One of the men was severely injured. The attackers stole money and valuables from the men.

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
assoc_actor_1: APCLS-M: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (Mapenzi)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: On 20 Nov 2018, the NDC Guidon and the Mapenzi Group attacked an APCLS position at Kataheta village in Masisi territory. Three civilians were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Rwanda (1994-)
notes: On 20 Nov 2018, Rwanda Defence Force (RDF) soldiers seriously wounded a civilian man on Lake Kivu near Birhalihale village in Idjwi territory. The victim later succumbed to his injuries in Goma hospital.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kizamoto)
notes: On Nov 19, the Raia Mutomboki Kazimoto looted 200 kilograms of cassiterite money from AGEFRECO transport agents near Lukala village in Shabunda territory. The attackers forced ten men to carry the looted goods.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Nov 19, students from the University of Kinshasa demonstrated, giving the government 48 hours to resume classes. Police used tear gas, students respond with stones and other projectiles.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Nov 18, a soldier attacked a congregation of mourners, shooting dead five people and injuring ten others in Tshikapa the Kasai region in the central DRC.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 18 Nov 2018, the ADF targeted people on board of a jeep and a motorcycle near Mukoko village of Beni territory. Two people were killed and the vehicles burned.

actor1: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 17, the home of FDLR-FOCA fighter was attacked by unidentified gunmen at Bugomba village in Rutshuru territory. The attackers killed the said commander.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On November 16, a student was killed during clashes with police. The students were protesting the death of one of them, on the same campus, earlier this week.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On Nov 16, violent fighting between the FARDC-Monusco elements and the ADF rebels occurred in Boikene district of Beni near the Monusco Base called "Madiba". Casualties are unknown.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
assoc_actor_2: Fishermen (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 16, two fishermen were shot and wounded by the Mai-Mai Charles on Lake Edward near Mulindi village in Rutshuru territory (approx. coordinates). The victims had requested an extension for the payment of a tax imposed by the militiamen. One of the wounded succumbed to his injuries.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 15 November. The LRA attacked Pasi. The group looted the village and abducted four men, a woman and a baby. They later released the woman and child.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 15, students violently demonstrated in front of the University in Kinshasa for the death of one of their fellows.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On Nov 15, ADF militiamen attacked Mambanika village near Oicha in Beni territory, killing five people and injuring three others. The attackers also burned houses and looted property.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Mbororo Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 15, miners in Dikuma, a locality of Ango territory, some 500 km north of Kisangani rose up against the death of 5 miners. The Mbororo herders sought refuge in the FARDC camp in Bweli. FARDC managed to restore order.

actor1: Tshiyoyo Militia
assoc_actor_2: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
notes: During the week of Nov 12th, two PPRD candidates in the legislative elections in Dibaya were kidnapped by armed men led by the militia leader Tshiyoyo.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On Nov 15, ADF militiamen attacked the city of Beni killing 5 people and burning many houses of the village.

actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On Nov 14, a dozen deaths were recorded in clashes between Burundian soldiers and Burundian rebels of the National Forces for Liberation (FNL) in Uvira and Fizi, in the province of South Kivu. FARDC sources said Wednesday (14 November) that a total of sixteen people were killed in the fighting. Fatalities are disaggregated in the two events (36,37)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 13, three men were kidnapped from the Mangina district of the Mangina rural commune by unknown armed men.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 13 Nov 2018, an FARDC soldier shot and seriously wounded a man at Kimuka village in Uvira territory. The victim succumbed to his injuries in Bukavu.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Nov 12, a student was killed during demonstrations against teachers' strike in Kinshasa.

assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 12, four miners were killed while they were on their way back from the mines when they fell into an ambush laid by eight Mbororo herders.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kokodikoko)
notes: 10 November. A Raia Mutomboki group abducted four women from Nzovu. They held the women for three days, during which time they were raped. The presence of child soldiers - including eight year old girls - suggests the attackers belonged to the Raia Mutomboki Kokodikoko.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 11, a woman and a man were kidnapped by unidentified gunmen from the Mabanga neighborhood in Goma town. The kidnappers demanded a ransom of $20000 for the release of the hostages.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 11, a man was killed with a machete in his field at Kituva village near Kabase in Masisi territory by unidentified men.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On Nov 10, ADF militiamen killed five people and kidnapped three children (a girl aged 4 and two boys aged 6 and 12) in Mayi Moya village of Beni territory. They also stole goats and other possessions.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 10, unknown gunmen killed two adults and their three children in Boikene neighborhood of Beni town. The attackers also burned houses, a car and other property and looted farm animals.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 9, a man was kidnapped by unknown armed men from Mangoyo village (a few km north of Bingo - approx. coordinates used) in Beni territory.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 November. Suspected ADF fighters attacked a FARDC base in Silimbamba (coordinates are approximate, based on location 40 km north-east of Beni). Six soldiers were killed.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On Nov 8, Burundi forces and FNL militiamen clashed in Mulenge.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: On Nov 8, three women were kidnapped by FDLR-RUD combatants from the Buturande district of the Kiwanja rural commune. They raped two women and demanded a ransom for the release of the hostages.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Lemera Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On Nov 3, the ADF raided Mambanika village in Beni territory killing one man and abducting four girls and ten boys.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
notes: On Nov 3, the Mai-Mai Kilalo attacked the military prosecutor's office in the Cite-Belge neighbourhood of Beni town. The FARDC guards fired but did not resist the assault. The attackers managed to release 35 detainees. An FARDC soldier was reported missing.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 September. One person was shot dead in Kasindi, bordered with Uganda.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 24 September. The Army regained control of a number of towns in and around Kilembwe in Fizi territory occupied for more than a week by a Mai-Mai militia led by Yakutumba (a coalition of Malaika and Alleluia militias). Yakutumba withdrew without a fight in the locality of Kilembwe. Coded as two separate events, one battle-gov regains, one non-violent transfer.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 24 September. Police dispersed protesters at Busawa village in Mwenga territory. The population was protesting the release of the territory's administrator.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 24 Sept 2018, the ADF raided Bakaiku neighbourhood in Oicha rural district. They killed one person and abducted one adult and 16 children. The attackers also burned houses and looted cattle and property.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 20-21 September. FARDC regained several territory from the Mai-Mai Yakutumba along the border between Maniema and South-Kivu over two days of fighting. On the first day, fighting in Tubangoyi (Sud-Kivu) left fatalities on both sides. The next day, clashes were reported in Kabeya (Maniema), Mai Ndombe (Sud-Kivu) and Kilembwe (Sud-Kivu). Coordinates of Tubangoyi and Mai Ndombe are approximates based on humanitarian maps.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 September. Eleven people, including one soldier, were killed in attacks on FARDC naval forces' positions in Muvaramu, Songamoya and Tara in Djugu territory (Ituri) between 15-16 September (later reports indicated 15 fatalities). Approximately 30 people were abducted during the attacks. Eleven fatalities spread across the three locations. Approx. Coordinates used for all locations at around 80km north of Bunia along the Lake Albert.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: 15 September. The FARDC went to support the Burundian army at Gatumba border post during a RED TABARA attack. Attackers killed three FARDC soldiers and two children in Uvira.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 September. Lendu militias attacked FARDC troops in Muvaramu (80 north east of Bunia). 9 soldiers killed and 6 civilians dead. Weapons and ammunition stolen

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 September. Between 2 and 4 am, police apprehended seven males, including teenagers, from the Kauka neighborhood of Kalamu. Five of the detainees were found dead the following day, at least one of the victim's genitals were cut off. The two others were forcibly disappeared. The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 September (on or around). In mid-September, the ADF overtook the FARDC base in Kididiwe (coordinates approximate), in the Mayangose region. Much of the local population fled the area following the ADF's occupation.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 September (on or around). In mid-September, the ADF overtook the FARDC base at Point 46/Malolu in the Mayangose region (no coordinates available, in the Beni territory north of Beni city). Much of the local population fled the area following the ADF's occupation.

actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: 14 September. FNL attacked a Burundian border post. Two FNL forces and one Burundian soldier killed. Percise place at border not known.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 14 September. NDC-R captured Pitakongo (Bitakongo) from Mai-Mai

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 13 September. Five unidentified gunmen raided a house in the Mangodomu neighborhood of Mangina rural district. The attackers shot and killed a 32-year-old man.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

assoc_actor_2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. Two agents of the Congolese Institute for the Conservation of Nature were seriously injured during an ambush held on their convoy by suspected LRA rebels in Banda, an area in Dikuma.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. An unidentified armed group clashed with the FARDC in Mavivi, Oicha. Five fatalities were reported during attacks in Mavivi, Matembo, Nzuma, and Ngadi. The fatalities have been spread among the locations (3 events).

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Bakwa Ndaye Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 09 September 2018 (on or around). During the weekend, communal tensions broke out in the Katende area, as Bakwa Ndaye assaulted over 50 members of a different ethnic group. Five houses, as well as other property, was destroyed.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 September. Twenty people were seriously injured, shops and houses looted and many other material damage reported during the skirmishes in the evening at Balese neighbourhood in Mangobo commune in Kisangani. The unrest stemmed from a dispute between the Kata motorcycle youth association of the Matete district and the Bourgeois youth association of the Balese district.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kokodikoko)
notes: 08-09 September. Masudi Alimasi Kokodikoko's Raia Mutomboki forces abducted seventeen women and girls (age 15-70) in the Shabunda territory. The group then held the women in a cave for four days, where they subjected them to rape and other forms of sexual violence. Kokodikoko raped at least nine of the women.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Binakwa)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On or before 07 September. The Raia Mutomboki Kokodikoko shot and killed a policeman in Bulumbu village in Bamuguba Sud grouping, east Shabunda (coordinate approx. based on source map). The policeman killed was the commander of the Kigulube police station.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: On 7 Sept 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a man in Kakomero village of Rutshuru territory. The FARDC suspected the victim from being a Nyatura fighter.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 07 September 2018. The FRPI looted Banikonza, Bandikama and Batine, Ituri (no coordinates available, located next to Nyakunde town).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 06 September 2018. A suspected robber was caught and lynched by a mob in Matadi.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 05 September. Clashes between the FARDC and Nyatura fighters left at least two civilians killed and five seriously injured in the town of Rugari, Rutshuru territory, North Kivu. Among the wounded, there are two soldiers. Later reports indicate four fatalities. The military indicated that the assailants were FDLR fighters, not Nyatura combatants.

notes: 04 September. At least 23 peaceful protesters were injured, six of them severely, while another 89 were arrested in the capital Kinshasa, and in Goma, Lubumbashi, Bukavu, Mbandaka, Mbuji-Mayi and Tshikapa as police violently dispersed peaceful protests on the use of electronic voting machines in the upcoming elections slated for 23 December. Among the arrested were seven LUCHA activists, they were released the following day.

Police fired live bullets at the protesters and arrested some, some of whom were quickly released. A young boy died of his injuries while others were hospitalised.

notes: On August 6, unidentified gunmen ambushed a FARDC team that was looking for a missing man in a field in Sulungwe village, Beni territory. A man died during this ambush.

notes: 06 August 2018. Police exchanged fire with an unidentified armed group in Kananga. The assailants fled into the bush.

notes: 05 August 2018 (on or around). An armed group from the Kibombo territory burned down the villages of Uwanda and Iyokalondo (no coordinates available; located in the Dikoka district). The assailants sought control over fishing grounds. The inhabitants of the villages were forced to flee into the bush.
